alert.note: Alert for Crockett; Dyer; Lauderdale (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 10:03AM CST until further notice by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Memphis TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Tennessee... South Fork of the Forked Deer near Halls affecting Crockett, Dyer and Lauderdale Counties. For the South Fork Forked Deer River...including Jackson, Halls... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork of the Forked Deer near Halls. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Farmland near the river is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 5.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 7.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall to 6.5 feet this evening. It will rise above flood stage late tonight to 11.5 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.4 feet on 12/19/2002. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM CST.
